required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacodynamics of Tafluprost 0.0015% Eye Drops: a Comparison Between the Preserved and Unpreserved Formulation
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacodynamics of Tafluprost 0.0015% Eye Drops: a Comparison Between the Preserved and Unpreserved Formulation in Patients With Open-angle Glaucoma or Ocular Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to investigate the pharmacodynamics (as expressed in intraocular pressure [IOP]) of two formulations of tafluprost 0.0015% eyedrops (preserved and unpreserved) in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.
The primary aim of this study is to show that IOP reduction between the two formulations is equivalent at the end of the 4 week treatment period.

primary_outcome.description: IOPs at baseline: mean IOP values at four timepoints (worse eye)
IOPs at week 1: mean IOP values at four timepoints (worse eye)
IOPs at week 4: mean IOP values at four timepoints (worse eye)

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Pharmacodynamic Variable Intention to Treat Efficacy Dataset: Change From Baseline in the Overall Diurnal Intraocular Pressure (IOP) at Week 4 (Worse Eye)
primary_outcome.description: Overall treatment difference at 4 weeks (unpreserved-preserved) evaluated using a repeated measurements analysis of covariance (RM ANCOVA) model.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Pharmacodynamic Variable Per Protocol Efficacy Dataset: Change From Baseline in the Overall Diurnal Intraocular Pressure (IOP) at Week 4 (Worse Eye)
primary_outcome.description: Overall treatment difference at 4 weeks (unpreserved-preserved) evaluated using a repeated measurments analysis of covariance (RM ANCOVA) model.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall and Time-wise Comparisons of IOP at Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: The overall and time-wise, i.e. at 8:00, 12:00, 16:00 and 20:00, comparisons of IOP at week 1 (diurnal IOP and IOP value at given timepoint at 1 week minus corresponding value at baseline: unpreserved-preserved) were done using the RM ANCOVA model.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Time-wise IOPs at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: The time-wise, i.e. at 8:00, 12:00, 16:00 and 20:00, comparisons of IOP at week 4 (IOP value at given timepoint at 4 weeks minus corresponding value at baseline: unpreserved-preserved) were done using the RM ANCOVA model.

intervention.description: Eye drops, 0.015 mg/ml, once daily to affected eye(s)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 years or more
- A diagnosis of open angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension
- Prior use of prostaglandin(s)
- Intra ocular pressure of 22-34 mmHg in at least one eye
Exclusion Criteria:
- Females who are pregnant, nursing or planning a pregnancy, or females of childbearing potential who are not using a reliable method of contraception
- Previous participation in any clinical trial in which tafluprost was an investigational drug or use of contact lenses at screening or during the study
- Presence of any abnormality or significant illness that could be expected to interfere with the study

participant_flow.recruitment_details: At 2 centers in Germany, 1 center in Finland: 14 September 2005 first patient screened 08 November 2005 first patient randomized 05 April 2006 last patient completed
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 45 patients screened and 43 patients randomized. 2 screening failure patients: 1 withdrawn consent and 1 too low IOP (inclusion criterion 4).

group.title: Preserved Formulation First, Then Unpreserved Formulation
group.description: Tafluprost 0.0015% preserved formulation once daily for first 4 weeks, then unpreserved formulation (after washout)

group.title: Unpreserved Formulation First, Then Preserved Formulation
group.description: Tafluprost 0.0015% unpreserved formulation once daily for first 4 weeks, then preserved formulation (after washout)

participants_list.participants: A patient completed the first treatment period but discontinued thereafter (did not start washout).

measure.title: Diagnosis - worse eyes
measure.description: Worse eye: If both eyes satisfied the inclusion criteria, then the worse eye was the eye with the higher intraocular pressure at the 8:00 IOP measurement at the first baseline visit. In case both eyes had the same IOP, then the right eye was designated as the worse eye. If only one eye satisfied the inclusion criteria, then that eye was considered to be the worse eye.

outcome.title: Intraocular Pressures (IOPs) at Baseline
outcome.description: IOPs at baseline: mean IOP values at four timepoints (worse eye)
outcome.population: IOPs of all subjects who received preserved/unpreserved formulation

measure.title: Intraocular Pressures (IOPs) at Baseline
measure.description: IOPs at baseline: mean IOP values at four timepoints (worse eye)
measure.population: IOPs of all subjects who received preserved/unpreserved formulation

outcome.title: Overall and Time-wise Comparisons of IOP at Week 1
outcome.description: The overall and time-wise, i.e. at 8:00, 12:00, 16:00 and 20:00, comparisons of IOP at week 1 (diurnal IOP and IOP value at given timepoint at 1 week minus corresponding value at baseline: unpreserved-preserved) were done using the RM ANCOVA model.
outcome.population: ITT: randomized patients who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one pharmacodynamic (IOP) measurement available.

measure.title: Overall and Time-wise Comparisons of IOP at Week 1
measure.description: The overall and time-wise, i.e. at 8:00, 12:00, 16:00 and 20:00, comparisons of IOP at week 1 (diurnal IOP and IOP value at given timepoint at 1 week minus corresponding value at baseline: unpreserved-preserved) were done using the RM ANCOVA model.
measure.population: ITT: randomized patients who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one pharmacodynamic (IOP) measurement available.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Time-wise IOPs at Week 4
outcome.description: The time-wise, i.e. at 8:00, 12:00, 16:00 and 20:00, comparisons of IOP at week 4 (IOP value at given timepoint at 4 weeks minus corresponding value at baseline: unpreserved-preserved) were done using the RM ANCOVA model.
outcome.population: ITT: randomized patients who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one pharmacodynamic (IOP) measurement available.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Time-wise IOPs at Week 4
measure.description: The time-wise, i.e. at 8:00, 12:00, 16:00 and 20:00, comparisons of IOP at week 4 (IOP value at given timepoint at 4 weeks minus corresponding value at baseline: unpreserved-preserved) were done using the RM ANCOVA model.
measure.population: ITT: randomized patients who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one pharmacodynamic (IOP) measurement available.

outcome.title: Intraocular Pressures (IOPs) at Week 1
outcome.description: IOPs at week 1: mean IOP values at four timepoints (worse eye)
outcome.population: IOPs of all subjects who received preserved/unpreserved formulation

measure.title: Intraocular Pressures (IOPs) at Week 1
measure.description: IOPs at week 1: mean IOP values at four timepoints (worse eye)
measure.population: IOPs of all subjects who received preserved/unpreserved formulation

outcome.description: IOPs at week 4: mean IOP values at four timepoints (worse eye)
outcome.population: IOPs of all subjects who received preserved/unpreserved formulation

measure.title: Intraocular Pressures (IOPs) at Week 4
measure.description: IOPs at week 4: mean IOP values at four timepoints (worse eye)
measure.population: IOPs of all subjects who received preserved/unpreserved formulation

outcome.title: Primary Pharmacodynamic Variable Intention to Treat Efficacy Dataset: Change From Baseline in the Overall Diurnal Intraocular Pressure (IOP) at Week 4 (Worse Eye)
outcome.description: Overall treatment difference at 4 weeks (unpreserved-preserved) evaluated using a repeated measurements analysis of covariance (RM ANCOVA) model.
outcome.population: Intention To Treat (ITT): randomized patients who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one pharmacodynamic (IOP) measurement available.

group.title: RM ANCOVA: ITT Efficacy Dataset
group.description: randomized who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one IOP measurement

measure.title: Primary Pharmacodynamic Variable Intention to Treat Efficacy Dataset: Change From Baseline in the Overall Diurnal Intraocular Pressure (IOP) at Week 4 (Worse Eye)
measure.description: Overall treatment difference at 4 weeks (unpreserved-preserved) evaluated using a repeated measurements analysis of covariance (RM ANCOVA) model.
measure.population: Intention To Treat (ITT): randomized patients who received at least one dose of study medication and had at least one pharmacodynamic (IOP) measurement available.

analysis.groups_desc: H1 (the alternative hypothesis aimed to be proven): the unpreserved formulation is equivalent with the preserved formulation
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The equivalence limit was set to 1.5 mmHg. Equivalence was shown if the two-sided 95% confidence interval for the difference (unpreserved-preserved) lay entirely within the equivalence range (-1.5 mmHg, 1.5 mmHg). Target sample size was 34 evaluable patients (40 randomized), assuming a standard deviation of 3.0 mmHg change in IOP, a power of 80%, an intra-class correlation coefficient of 0.60 and a twosided type 1 error rate of 5%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Analysis model used IOP measurements at four timepoints (at 8, 12, 16 and 20 o'clock) on Baseline and Week 4.

outcome.title: Primary Pharmacodynamic Variable Per Protocol Efficacy Dataset: Change From Baseline in the Overall Diurnal Intraocular Pressure (IOP) at Week 4 (Worse Eye)
outcome.description: Overall treatment difference at 4 weeks (unpreserved-preserved) evaluated using a repeated measurments analysis of covariance (RM ANCOVA) model.
outcome.population: Per Protocol (PP): randomized patients who completed the study per protocol (i.e. excluded from PP is the discontinued patient and a patient with major protocol violation)

group.title: RM ANCOVA: PP Efficacy Dataset
group.description: randomized patients who completed the study per protocol (PP)

measure.title: Primary Pharmacodynamic Variable Per Protocol Efficacy Dataset: Change From Baseline in the Overall Diurnal Intraocular Pressure (IOP) at Week 4 (Worse Eye)
measure.description: Overall treatment difference at 4 weeks (unpreserved-preserved) evaluated using a repeated measurments analysis of covariance (RM ANCOVA) model.
measure.population: Per Protocol (PP): randomized patients who completed the study per protocol (i.e. excluded from PP is the discontinued patient and a patient with major protocol violation)

analysis.groups_desc: H1 (the alternative hypothesis aimed to be proven): the unpreserved formulation is equivalent with the preserved formulation
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The equivalence limit was set to 1.5 mmHg. Equivalence was shown if the two-sided 95% confidence interval for the difference (unpreserved-preserved) lay entirely within the equivalence range (-1.5 mmHg, 1.5 mmHg). Target sample size was 34 evaluable patients (40 randomized), assuming a standard deviation of 3.0 mmHg change in IOP, a power of 80%, an intra-class correlation coefficient of 0.60 and a twosided type I error rate of 5%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Analysis model used IOP measurements at four timepoints (at 8, 12, 16 and 20 o'clock) on Baseline and Week 4

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data was collected at Week 1 and Week 4 visits of treatment period I and II, as well as on last Post-study visit. Additionally, baseline symptoms were queried on Day 0 (=Baseline) visit of the two treatment periods.
reported_events.desc: Patients were asked about ocular or non-ocular symptoms with a non-leading question, or they volunteered the information during a study visit. Also, any clinically significant signs observed by the investigator could be recorded as adverse events.

group.title: Preserved Formulation
group.description: Tafluprost 0.0015% preserved formulation once daily for 4 weeks

group.title: Unpreserved Formulation
group.description: Tafluprost 0.0015% unpreserved formulation once daily for first 4 weeks

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The sponsor respects the investigators' wish to publish results of the study, and will not unnecessarily restrict the spreading of information of scientific interest. However, the study may involve confidential information affecting the company's business, such as aspects related to patent application. Therefore, the investigators agree to allow the sponsor to review any manuscripts and to negotiate timing and forum of publication.
